alert.note: Alert for Lonoke; Monroe; Prairie (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 3:03AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Woodruff, Prairie, eastern Lonoke, Monroe and southeastern White Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 303 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from McRae to near Thurman to near Barrettsville to near Parkers Corner. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brinkley... Des Arc... Clarendon... Hazen... De Valls Bluff... Carlisle... Fredonia... Roe... Hunter... Barrettsville... Alfrey... Allendale... Dobbs Landing... McCreanor... Thurman... Stuttgart Municipal Airport... Peppers Landing... Prairie Center... Parkers Corner... Hallsville... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for central Arkansas. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for eastern and central Arkansas.
